ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It is a good introduction to computational methods in quantum chemistry

My summary of CHEM 572 to a fellow student would be that the class in question provides a summary of advanced quantum mechanical models and applications in a disorganized and unrealistic manner for the average student who will be taking the course. I would not recommend this course to another student unless they had already previously seen the material in question, and needed to review these concepts.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I learnt many computational methods in modeling chemical system

I believe this course has given me a general perspective on mathematical approaches and models employed in advanced quantum mechanical systems, but only to a certain extent. This extent is limited well below any concrete understanding of how to evaluate a given problem that I might encounter in my research.
